title: Tokyo Style Chintan

ingredients.name: stewing hen (approximately 3 kg), broken down into primal sections

steps: Add the chicken to a stockpot, cover with water.
Bring the soup up to a boil briefly, skim any scum. Hold here for 5-10 minutes, or until scum subsides.
Reduce heat back down to below simmer (around 88°C/190°F), hold for 5 hours.
Add your onion, garlic, ginger, niboshi, and kombu. Cook for an additional 45 minutes.
In the last 10 minutes, add the bonito flake and steep.
Strain the soup and hold it until needed.
notes: This recipe is a combination of chicken and dashi elements.
Simple and effective with many different ramen tares.
Can be made in pressure cooker: 45 minutes at pressure (or 30 minutes with 30-minute natural release).
Can be stored for up to a week in the fridge or 6 months in the freezer.
From 'The Book of Ramen' - Chapter 2: Soup
